New Records: South Africa successfully defended its lowly total of 6-113, the lowest target ever defended in a T20 World Cup, trumping India's defence of 120 runs against Pakistan just the day before.
Key Match Events: Aiden Markram took the catch that saved his team from losing to Bangladesh in the second last ball of the match.
Keshav Maharaj bowled a six-run, two-wicket final over and South Africa held off Bangladesh by four runs.
Heinrich Klaasen top-scored with 46 off 44, including two fours and three sixes.
Pre-Game Insights: There is no pre-game insights available in the article.
Post-Match Reflections: Heinrich Klaasen said, 'That was not nice on the heart, but feels good that we got over the line.'
Heinrich Klaasen also said, 'This wicket is not great for stroke play. We got some information from the last game and applied it today.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Nassau County Stadium, and the wicket was not great for stroke play.
South Africa completed the group stage against Nepal on Friday, and Bangladesh has the Netherlands on Thursday.
